body:
As you can most likely tell - I've been demoted.

I got this message.

"Unfortunately, the Sr Staff team has decided to revoke your Moderator rank, and demote you during the reassessment. This is due to the fact that you haven’t been very consistent with your job in detecting hacks, and overall moderation (http://avicus.net/infractions?staff=awesome_apricot.) If you have a concern, message me or another admin."

Apparently I am not up to standards.
[15/08/2015 23:46:51] Tyler / DoctaPop / PoppaDoc: Well, it was also the fact that yes, you did do reports a lot, just wasn't very...
[15/08/2015 23:46:51] Tyler / DoctaPop / PoppaDoc: Right

I still can't make sense of that. ^

Oh, and if I did all of this (below) what was the problem?

[15/08/2015 23:44:27] Tyler / DoctaPop / PoppaDoc: You did a lot. We've all established that.
[15/08/2015 23:44:34] Tyler / DoctaPop / PoppaDoc: You were the most active streamer and honestly
[15/08/2015 23:44:37] Tyler / DoctaPop / PoppaDoc: the only good streamer
[15/08/2015 23:44:49] Tyler / DoctaPop / PoppaDoc: You did a lot with the media, and you were working on making a whole rank for it
[15/08/2015 23:45:06] Tyler / DoctaPop / PoppaDoc: and you were advertising I heard

I am still waiting for a clear answer. 

I do not see what it was that I had done wrong; it wasn't like I never went on TS, or never did reports, or never went on the forums, or never actively involved myself in the community. 

For me this just shows what Avicus just does wrong. Take Tyn for example. He was on leave - and got demoted for inactivity. When he challenged the decision they said it was from before his LoA. Fishy. 

I had been working on a Social Media project and was only really getting started. I'd become more active on the Twitter handle that it had ever seen before and was literally just about to pay real moneys into promoting the server on Facebook. 

This work went mostly unnoticed and I didn't really mind - I'm not that attention seeking.

To be frank, I loved being a moderator, but will never come back to that shit. People I thought I trusted stabbed me in the back. And for that I'm pretty pissed off. Oh, and yet to mention Steven was promoted. Not to be mean Steven, you're a nice kid, just not a mature moderator. 

Oh, and did I mention it was without warning. 

When I came back I was told by the senior staff they wanted me to change the way I moderated chat - to be less casual and be stricter. And I did. I constantly asked whether I was doing ok, but only got "yeah, fine"'s. 

A warning would have been nice, to be honest, so thanks for that.

But ya, a bug SMH to Avicus. I'll stick around for a bit to play around and have shits and giggles but i feel I've been well and truly done over here after all. 

PS seniors don't tell me to take this to a private place, I have nothing to hide and you shouldn't either because it's a community thing.

replies.body: Senior staff, pls respond.
replies.body_tagged: Senior staff, pls respond.

replies.body:
Apricot, no. You established a lot of contributions and basis for things that I've not seen other staff members do, and I feel like out of the moderator team, there's only a few that go above and beyond moderating. You did a lot more, you were willing to do it, and you had so much more potential than you ever got credit for. By standing on the sidelines, I saw you act not only mature and well conducted, but one of the most approachable and kind staff members that, even, impressed me. Your infractions seem to be consistent and you did take reports a lot -- probably more than most, and even me, but I still have to honor everything you did as a moderator.

I don't know the context or story behind your demotion, but with the vague answer given, that I do not agree with. I do not agree with how there may not be evidence provided or presented to you, and I don't agree with demoting you withholding absolutely no warning. There's been a lot of disorganization and misconceptions as it's been a rough couple of weeks for the staff team, going through admins and senior mods a lot, but you had upmost potential to go farther and it's mind boggling how you were completely booted out. I can only say for now best wishes, but you were quite so an honor to work with, an honor to talk to, and an honor having you as a map maker for the time I was map developer - so many interesting conversations sparked.

You were one of a kind, I hope to see you back in the staff team soon, and hopefully with all ends tied. I think you deserve another chance, and I hope in your name and honor that you won't behave salty about your demotion. You helped author the next chapter to avicus, you should finish it. So many good ideas and helpful motives wasted if you don't.

You actually even helped motivate me...

replies.body:
#ApricotDidNothingWrong

This is TortouseMuncher here; using his alt because he got forum-banned for HTML glitch spamming.

Miscommunication has always been a highlight of the Senior Staff team. Someone always gets demoted because someone claims, that someone else claimed that someone did something wrong. Demoting staff should be closely looked at. Written CLEAR warnings should be given. If you want the staff member to be better, fucking tell them. If you demote a staff member that clearly has potential, you're losing an investment. Retraining other mods to do what that member has done is time consuming so, uselessly throwing away valuable possessions is illogical. If they don't know that they've done something wrong; they'll resume to do it. So instead of not telling them because you want to stab them in the back later just say something.

Being specific to April; he is a dedicated member who has been with Avicus from day one. Demoting him without a fully fledged investigation and then clumsily asking for him to join back shows how dis-organised the Senior staff team really is. 

But I guess power-hungry Senior Staff members have to solve their hunger somehow.
